segment.source: Support for Client Reporting over HTTP
segment.target: Support for Client Reporting over HTTP

segment.source: Support for Client Reporting over HTTP
segment.target: Support for Client Reporting over HTTP

segment.source: Support for Client Reporting over HTTP
segment.target: Support for Client Reporting over HTTP

segment.source: Version 4.6 of the App-V client now supports the use of HTTP communication when sending client reporting data to the publishing server.
segment.target: Version 4.6 of the App-V client now supports the use of HTTP communication when sending client reporting data to the publishing server.

segment.source: This feature supports scenarios where a customer has implemented a custom HTTP(S) publishing server that is configured to collect and process client data.
segment.target: This feature supports scenarios where a customer has implemented a custom HTTP(S) publishing server that is configured to collect and process client data.

segment.source: For more information on HTTP publishing servers, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157426
segment.target: For more information on HTTP publishing servers, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157426

segment.source: The client starts collecting data when it receives a “REPORTING=”TRUE””attribute in the publishing refresh response XML from the publishing server.
segment.target: The client starts collecting data when it receives a “REPORTING=”TRUE””attribute in the publishing refresh response XML from the publishing server.

segment.source: When this attribute is received, the client sends any accumulated data to the publishing server that sent the publishing refresh.
segment.target: When this attribute is received, the client sends any accumulated data to the publishing server that sent the publishing refresh.

segment.source: The details of this process are as follows:
segment.target: The details of this process are as follows:

segment.source: The client sends an HTTP GET request to the publishing server for a publishing refresh.
segment.target: The client sends an HTTP GET request to the publishing server for a publishing refresh.

segment.source: The header of this message contains an “AppV-Op:Refresh” custom header that the custom HTTP(S) publishing server uses to identify the message type.
segment.target: The header of this message contains an “AppV-Op:Refresh” custom header that the custom HTTP(S) publishing server uses to identify the message type.

segment.source: The publishing server then sends the publishing refresh response XML that contains a “REPORTING=”TRUE”” value.
segment.target: The publishing server then sends the publishing refresh response XML that contains a “REPORTING=”TRUE”” value.

segment.source: The client then sends an HTTP POST request to the publishing server along with the reporting data that has been gathered since the previous refresh.
segment.target: The client then sends an HTTP POST request to the publishing server along with the reporting data that has been gathered since the previous refresh.

segment.source: The header of this message contains an “AppV-Op:Report” custom header that the custom HTTP(S) publishing server uses to identify the message type.
segment.target: The header of this message contains an “AppV-Op:Report” custom header that the custom HTTP(S) publishing server uses to identify the message type.

segment.source: The following schema gives specific details of the package and the application data that is sent to the server.
segment.target: The following schema gives specific details of the package and the application data that is sent to the server.
